Wishnutama Mau Sertifikat HAKI Bisa Jadi Jaminan Modal Usaha
07 Nov 2019, 06:23 by Herdi Alif Al Hikam


Menteri Pariwisata dan Ekonomi Kreatif (Menparekraf) Wishnutama Kusubandio/Foto: Rifkianto Nugroho

Jakarta - Menteri Pariwisata dan Ekonomi Kreatif (Menparekraf) Wishnutama Kusubandio menyatakan bahwa pihaknya ingin membuat sertifikat hak kekayaan intelektual (HAKI) memiliki nilai lebih. Menurutnya, HAKI bisa dijadikan jaminan bagi para pelaku ekonomi kreatif untuk mendapatkan modal."Saya mau perjuangkan HAKI itu jadi modal masa depan kita (pelaku ekonomi kreatif). Kita akan perjuangkan ke situ," ucap pria yang akrab dipanggil Tama ini, pada acara Rakernas Ekonomi Kreatif Kadin 2019 di Hotel Sultan, Jakarta, Kamis (7/11/2019).Pria yang akrab disapa Tama mengatakan pihaknya sedang memperjuangkan sertifikat HAKI pada suatu produk bisa dijadikan sebagai jaminan untuk pinjaman modal usaha."Sertifikat HAKI itu harus punya value lebih bagi pelaku ekonomi kreatif. Kita akan usahakan bisa dijadikan jaminan untuk pinjaman modal usaha," ucap Tama.Ia menginginkan ekonomi kreatif bisa semakin berkembang dan dihargai."Saya tuh mau kreativitas ini jadi valueable, karena muda saya dulu kreatif itu nggak dianggap," lanjutnya. Wishnutama Want IPR Certificate Can Be a Guarantee of Business Capital
Nov 7 2019, 06:23 by Herdi Alif Al Hikam


Minister of Tourism and Creative Economy (Menparekraf) Wishnutama Kusubandio / Photo: Rifkianto Nugroho

Jakarta - Minister of Tourism and Creative Economy (Menparekraf) Wishnutama Kusubandio stated that his party wants to make a certificate of intellectual property rights (IPR) has more value. According to him, Intellectual Property Rights can be used as a guarantee for creative economic actors to get capital. "I want to fight for Intellectual Property Rights as our future capital (creative economy actors). We will fight for it," said the man who is familiarly called Tama, at the Rakernas Kadin Creative Economy 2019 at the Sultan Hotel, Jakarta, Thursday (11/07/2019). The man who is familiarly called Tama said that he was fighting for IPR certificates on a product that could be used as collateral for business capital loans. "The IPR certificate must have more value "We will try to be able to be used as collateral for business capital loans," said Tama. He wants the creative economy to be more developed and appreciated. "I want this creativity to be valueable, because my young people were not creative," he continued. .
